data.event: Riverside, known as Cedar Grove until 1878, was originally a farming and fishing area.
The Lyric Theater opened on Maple Avenue around 1920 and featured silent movies until 1928 when the theater became the second in the state to have talking pictures.
The Lyric Theater opened on Maple Avenue around 1920 and featured silent movies until 1928 when the theater became the second in the state to have talking pictures.
The Riverside Girl Scout House, built around 1870, on Willett Avenue is the oldest school still standing in East Providence.
The all-male club still operates today.
